content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <metadata>    <idinfo>      <citation>        <citeinfo>          <origin>Tompkins County Assessment Department</origin>           <pubdate>20000701</pubdate>           <title>Town of Enfield Tax Parcels For Tax Year 2000 (ARC Export : 2000)</title>           <pubinfo>            <pubplace>Tompkins County</pubplace>             <publish>Tompkins County GIS Program</publish>          </pubinfo>           <onlink>http://cugir.mannlib.cornell.edu/bucketinfo.jsp?id=4961</onlink>        </citeinfo>      </citation>       <descript>        <abstract>The active tax parcel boundaries in the Town of Enfield organized by year. The data set includes previous lot lines (dashed consolidation lines), parcel connectors (z-hooks), parcel boundaries, printkey boundaries, deed boundaries, municipal boundaries, block boundaries, tax map boundaries, special district boundaries, and text layers for lot numbers, acreage, dimensions, etc.</abstract>         <purpose>The parcel boundaries represent legal descriptions of property ownership, as recorded in various public documents in the Tompkins County Clerk's Office.</purpose>         <supplinf>Only arcs (lines) have their boundaries updated during parcel revisions. Polygons are built from the arcs (lines) and label points (polygon centroids). All regions, except for the Condo region, are automatically created with a macro, based on values in the polygon's attributes. The arcs (lines) are coded to allow previous lot lines (i.e., dashed consolidation lines), parcel connectors (z-hooks), and yearly changes to be shown and tracked. All text is kept in annotation layers, organized by the name of the text layer. Regions are used to represent parcel boundaries, municipal boundaries, deeded areas, block boundaries, tax map boundaries, and special districts. There are two regions representing property boundaries (parcel and printkey) because properties that are tracked by an account number (state lands, utilities, railroads, etc.) may be shown as several separate tax parcel boundaries, with different tax map print keys, even though they are tracked in the Real Property Services (RPS) database under the same account number and treated as one single parcel for taxation purposes. The parcel region will show these account-number properties as one tax parcel boundary, while the printkey region will show each separate tax parcel boundary that is a part of the account number.</supplinf>      </descript>       <status>        <progress>Complete</progress>         <update>Continually</update>      </status>       <spdom>        <bounding>          <westbc>-76.43934</westbc>           <eastbc>-76.23547</eastbc>           <northbc>42.41797</northbc>           <southbc>42.29588</southbc>        </bounding>      </spdom>       <keywords>        <theme>          <themekt>None</themekt>           <themekey>Land record</themekey>           <themekey>Parcel</themekey>           <themekey>Assessment Department</themekey>           <themekey>RPS</themekey>        </theme>         <theme>          <themekt>LCSH</themekt>           <themekey>New York (State) -- Office of Real Property Services.</themekey>        </theme>         <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt>         <themekey>planningCadastre</themekey>       </theme>       <place>          <placekey>Tompkins County (N.Y.)</placekey>           <placekey>New York (State)</placekey>           <placekey>Finger Lakes Region (N.Y.) -- Maps.</placekey>           <placekey>Enfield (N.Y.)</placekey>        </place>         <temporal>          <tempkt>None</tempkt>           <tempkey>2000</tempkey>        </temporal>      </keywords>       <accconst>None</accconst>       <useconst>The following statement must be included with any products that use or are derived from this data set: Data contained in this product was originally produced by the Tompkins County GIS Program. The originator does not warrant the accuracy or completeness of the information portrayed by the data.</useconst>       <ptcontac>        <cntinfo>          <cntorgp>            <cntorg>Tompkins County Assessment Department</cntorg>          </cntorgp>           <cntaddr>            <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype>             <address>128 East Buffalo Street</address>             <city>Ithaca</city>             <state>New York</state>             <postal>14850</postal>             <country>USA</country>          </cntaddr>           <cntvoice>(607) 274-5517</cntvoice>           <cntfax>(607) 274-5507</cntfax>           <hours>M-F 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.</hours>        </cntinfo>      </ptcontac>       <datacred>Tompkins County GIS Program</datacred>       <crossref>        <citeinfo>          <origin>Tompkins County Assessment Department</origin>           <pubdate>July 1 each year</pubdate>           <title>Tompkins County Real Property Services (RPS) Database</title>           <othercit>The New York State mandated database of property ownership and information in Tompkins County. This database can be related to the digital tax parcels data sets using either the SWISPRINTK field or the PARCELKEY field.</othercit>        </citeinfo>      </crossref>    </idinfo>     <dataqual>      <attracc>        <attraccr>See Entity and Attribute Information</attraccr>      </attracc>       <logic>Spatial topology is maintained by the software. Lines are coded by the Layer field, and checked visually on-screen as they are updated, using a lookup table which shows the layers as various line types. Revision sheets are printed after each change to the data set, and are visually reviewed for errors. Regions are created by merging polygons with similar attributes (there is no manual user involvement). After the current-year tax roll is finalized by the Assessment Department, an extract of the roll is compared to the Parcel Region. Any identified errors are corrected, then the roll is compared again with the Parcel Region, until all errors have been eliminated. Other regions are checked visually for gaps, holes, and other problems, then corrected. Draft tax maps are produced in ArcView, then visually reviewed for errors. The final product is a data set and series of paper maps that reflect the final tax roll for a given tax year. The attributes in the various fields used to produce regions were originally populated using ArcView software. A "unique value" legend was used to aid in the visual identification of errors. After the regions were first created, further errors were identified visually by reviewing each region. New region layers will be created in the same way. The 1999 printed tax maps were reviewed for spatial and textual errors by the Assessment Department and New York State Office of Real Property Services (NYS ORPS). A quick analysis comparing calculated acreages in the data set to acreages recorded in the final tax roll was performed during 1999 and showed that the majority of parcels had GIS acreages within the NYS ORPS error guidelines.</logic>       <complete>Complete coverage for the City of Ithaca. As of 2000, tax parcel boundaries with adjoining municipalities have not been edge-matched.</complete>       <posacc>        <horizpa>          <horizpar>Varies, depending on source of parcel boundary (survey, deed, aerial photo, raw conversion from paper maps). The accuracy of the data set is limited to the accuracy of the 1991 Tompkins County Planimetric Base Map series.</horizpar>        </horizpa>         <vertacc>          <vertaccr>The Accuracy of the data set is limited to the accuracy of the 1991 Tompkins County Planimetric Base Map series.</vertaccr>        </vertacc>      </posacc>       <lineage>        <procstep>          <procdesc>Tax parcel boundaries were initially maintained manually on mylar originals, using erasable ink. In 1991, a series of planimetric base data sets were produced from aerial photography, and are now referred to as the 1991 Tompkins County Digital Planimetric Base Map. The tax parcel mylar maps were digitized using MapGrafix and referenced to the 1991 Tompkins County Digital Planimetric Base Map. In 1997, the MapGrafix data sets for the City of Ithaca and the Towns of Caroline and Danby were approved by the New York State Office of Real Property Services (NYS ORPS). In 1998, the Map Grafix data sets were converted to Arc/Info for the City of Ithaca, Towns of Caroline, Danby, Dryden, and Ithaca, and the Villages of Cayuga Heights, Dryden, and Freeville. In 1999, the Towns of Enfield, Groton, Lansing, Newfield, and Ulysses, and the Villages of Groton, Lansing, and Trumansburg were converted to Arc/Info. Beginning with the 1999 tax year, all tax parcel boundaries are maintained in Arc/Info, all tax maps are printed using ArcView, and all tax maps are archived digitally using Adobe Acrobat, as well as the traditional paper archival. During the transition period from paper to digital maps, parcel boundaries are approximate, except for those boundaries that have been input using paper surveys and legal descriptions. The tax parcel data sets consist of three groups of layers: boundary layers, text layers, and region layers. The boundary layers consist of those Arc/Info feature classes upon which the region layers are created. Boundary layers include the nodes, arcs, and polygons. Parcel boundaries are changed by first modifying the arc and node layers, and updating the arc attributes. Next, the polygons are re-created and their attributes are updated. The text layers are then updated to reflect the boundary changes. Finally, the regions are created from the polygons using polygon attributes and the Arc/Info REGIONDISSOLVE command. The text layers are Arc/Info annotation layers and include acreage, block, dimension, non-roll section 1 (exempt/utility/state lands), lot, Military Tract/Watkins and Flint Purchase, municipality, place, road name, special district, tax map, tic mark, and water text, as it appears on the printed tax parcel maps. The region layers include deed book/page, municipal, parcel, printkey, and tax map regions. The printkey regions from each of the municipal data sets for the current tax year are then combined into a county-wide data set, which is then converted to an ArcView shapefile. Regions for special districts are derived from polygon attributes in the same manner as the other regions, for each municipality, then combined into a County-wide special districts data set. Regions for public lands are similiarly combined and converted into a County-wide public lands data set.</procdesc>           <procdate>1990-2000</procdate>           <proccont>            <cntinfo> This field will be blank if not applicable.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>LatDD</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Lattitude (Y-coordinate), in decimal degrees, of the main parcel centroid (ie, the polygon centroid coded with PRCLTEXT equal to MP or SP).</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 2000.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>LegalAcre</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Confidence level of accuracy of the polygon boundary and associated area. The general order of accuracy from highest to lowest, using the enumerated domain values, is: SV, B, D, E, A/I/Q, P, L, C/NL/U. The values SV, B, and D have an accurate area value; all other values represent approximate area values.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>           <attrdomv>            <edom>              <edomv>A</edomv>               <edomvd>Approximate Boundary: Boundary lines are adjusted according to other surveys with smaller errors and/or more definite points of beginning OR the survey point of beginning is uncertain and the survey closure error is > 1/10,000 and/or the rotation of the survey to True North is uncertain.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>B</edomv>               <edomvd>Survey point of beginning is uncertain, survey closure error is < 1/10,000 and rotation to True North is accurate.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>C</edomv>               <edomvd>Cemetery without a deeded or surveyed boundary; shown as a + on the printed map and represented in the polygon layer by a circle with a 5-foot readius.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>D</edomv>               <edomvd>Parcel boundary is based on a deed description that is believed to be transcribed from an actual survey. The transcribed survey error is < 1/10,000, the point of beginning is accurate, and the rotation to True North is correct.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>E</edomv>               <edomvd>Survey closure error > 1/10,000, survey point of beginning is accurate, and rotation to True North is accurate.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>I</edomv>               <edomvd>Polygon boudnary is interpolated from other surveys and/or the 1991 Tompkins County Digital Planimetric Base Map.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>L</edomv>               <edomvd>Legal acreage of parcel as recorded in the Real Property Services (RPS) database is believed to be shown on a survey or transcribed from a deed that appears to be based on an actual survey. The RPS acreage number is the net acreage of the parcel, and does not include the area within the public rights-of-way.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>Pyyyy</edomv>               <edomvd>The polygon boundary is based on digital aerial photographs from the year yyyy; these photographs are not orthophotos, and are not corrected for topography.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>Oyyyy</edomv>               <edomvd>The polygon boundary is based on digital orthophotographs from the year yyyy. (The previous code for this enumeration was Qyyyy.) The COMMENTS1 field should specify the exact source of the orthophoto (for example: 1995 USGS/NYSDEC DOQQ).</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>NL</edomv>               <edomvd>No legal description based on a survey exists, and no actual survey exists for the property. This enumeration will include legal descriptions that are vague, are described relative to other properties and/or owners, and all other legal descriptions that do not appear to be based on a modern survey.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>R</edomv>               <edomvd>The survey point of beginning is accurate and the survey closure error is < 1/10,000, but the rotation to True North is not certain.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>SV</edomv>               <edomvd>The polygon boundaries are based on an actual survey that has an accurate point of beginning and a survey closure error < 1/10,000, and has been accurately rotated to True North.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>U</edomv>               <edomvd>It is unknown if an actual survey or legal description based on an actual survey exists.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>          </attrdomv>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>LightDist</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Light district taxation boundary. Used to create region.light in the Special Districts data set.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>LongDD</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Longitude (X-coordinate), in decimal degrees, of the main parcel centroid (ie, the polygon centroid coded with PRCLTEXT equal to MP or SP).</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 2000.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>Modified</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Date the polygon attributes were last modified and/or the date the polygon boundary was last modified.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>ParcelKey</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Real Property Services (RPS) Database parcel key (Swis-Section-Block-Lot or SSBL). This field is updated yearly based on the GIS extract of the final-roll RPS database. This field can be used to relate to the RPS database.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>PERIMETER</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Polygon Boundary Perimeter (Internal Software Attribute, in Map Units)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>PolyBlock</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Tax map block number in which the printed polygon will appear; this may differ from the polygon's parcel block number, which is shown in the PRINTKEY field.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>PolySwis</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Municipal SWIS code in which the printed polygon will appear; this may differ from the polygon's parcel swis code, which is shown in the SWIS field. This field is used to create the muni region for this data set. See the SWIS field's enumerated domain value explanation for further detail.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>PolyTaxMap</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Tax map block number in which the printed polygon will appear; this may differ from the polygon's parcel block number, which is shown in the PRINTKEY field.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>           <attrdomv>            <udom>1 - 37</udom>          </attrdomv>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>PrclText</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Type of polygon used to generate property boundaries in the printkey and parcel regions. This field is used to calculate the LEGALACRES field and to filter the polygon centroids for transferring the lattitude-longitude values to the Real Property Services (RPS) database.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>           <attrdomv>            <edom>              <edomv>C</edomv>               <edomvd>Cemetery without a deeded or surveyed boundary; shown as a + on the printed map and represented in the polygon layer by a circle with a 5-foot readius. These parcels will only show a lot number and a + on the printed map (they may or may not be larger than one acre, but no acreage is shown).</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>CP</edomv>               <edomvd>Consolidated Polygon; this polygon was consolidated into another parcel, but used to be a separate parcel or part of a separate parcel. The polygon's area is combined with the surrounding parcel's area on the printed tax maps (ie, the consolidated polygon's area is not shown separately on the printed maps). In addition, on the printed tax maps, these polygons will show a lot number half the size of the "active" lot numbers, placed in the lower right corner of the polygon, and will have dashed lines representing the former property lines.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>SP</edomv>               <edomvd>Single-polygon parcel; this parcel is composed of only one polygon. On the printed tax maps, these polygons will show the lot number and, if larger than one acre, the acreage.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>MP</edomv>               <edomvd>Multiple-polygon parcel "master" polygon; this parcel is composed of more than one polygon, either because it has other parcels consolidated into it, was too large to fit on a single printed tax map and had to be artificially split, and/or is split by a public or utility right of way. On the printed maps, these "master" polygons will show the lot number, the polygon's acreage, if larger than one acre, and a "grouped" or total acreage (Ac G) of all the parcel's polygons, if this total acreage is larger than one acre.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>SM</edomv>               <edomvd>This polygon is part of a multiple-polygon parcel, and is located on the same map as the "master" polygon. These polygons will usually have a parcel connector that ties it to the "master" polygon (or another SM/CP/PR polygon that is tied to the "master" polygon). The exceptions are (1) there is not enough room for a connector, (2) the polygon is tied in such a way as to be ambiguous (ie, tied via a different map), and (3) the polygon is the result of a special district boundary splitting a larger contiguous polygon. Iin the case or (1) and (2), the lot number will be shown on the printed maps, prefixed by the letters "P/O", which is an abbreviation of "part of", in addition to the connector and the polygon's acreage (if more than one acre). In the case of (3), the polygon boundary along the special district will not be shown on the printed map and no lot, acreage, or exempt text will be shown within the polygon; the polygon's area will be included in the surrounding polygon's.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>DM</edomv>               <edomvd>This polygon is part of a multiple-polygon parcel, and is located on a different map from the "master" polygon. These polygons will always have a parcel connector that ties it to the "master" polygon (or another SM/DM/CP/PR polygon that is tied to the "master" polygon). On the printed maps, the lot number will be shown, prefixed by the letters "P/O", which is an abbreviation of "part of", as well as the connector and the polygon's acreage (if more than one acre). Also, if the "master" polygon shows any exempt (wholly exempt, state-owned, utility, railroad) text, that text should be shown on at least one of the different-map polygons on the printed map.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>PR</edomv>               <edomvd>This polygon is a proposed parcel, as shown on a subdivision map or survey. The polygon is not currently an active parcel, but may be at a future date. For subdivisions, the COMMENTS1 field should include the subdivision lot number from the map. On the printed maps, the polygon's area is included in the surrounding "active" polygon's area and no dashed lines or other information about the proposed parcel is shown.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>OV</edomv>               <edomvd>This polygon represents an overlap of two surveys that were entered independently from different points of beginning. The polygon will receive the printkey of the more accurate survey, in terms of closure error.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>SL</edomv>               <edomvd>This polygon represents a gore (or sliver) resulting from two or more surveys that were entered independently from different points of beginning. The polygon will either be shown as a "hole" (usually appended to the public right of way) or will receive the printkey of the less accurate survey, in terms of closure error, and be appended to that survey.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>          </attrdomv>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>PrintKey</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Real Property Services database print key (Section-Block-Lot or S-B-L).</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>PriorDeed1</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Prior Deed Ids (Deed Book/Deed Page), 1 to 5, in chronological order from left (most recent) to right (least recent). In addition, arcs represent parcel connectors (z-hooks), previous lot lines (dashed consolidation lines), proposed lots, and yearly changes.</enttypd>           <enttypds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</enttypds>        </enttyp>         <attr>          <attrlabl>ANGLE</attrlabl>           <attrdef>COGO Line bearing or COGO Curve chord bearing (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>ARCLENGTH</attrlabl>           <attrdef>COGO Curve length (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>CAPRCL2000#</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Record number (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>CAPRCL2000-ID</attrlabl>           <attrdef>User-Id (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>DELTA</attrlabl>           <attrdef>COGO Curve delta (degrees of parent circle) (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>DISTANCE</attrlabl>           <attrdef>COGO Line length or COGO Curve chord length (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>Dxf-Curve</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Used in production of DXF files. For all arcs that have a value for the SIDE field, the value of DXF-CURVE will be 1. For all blank SIDE values, DXF-CURVE will be 0.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 2000.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>Dxf-Layer</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Redefine of LAYER field, used in production of DXF files.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 2000.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>Dxf-Thickness</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Redefine of YEAR field, used in production of DXF files.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 2000.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>FNODE#</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Arc's from-node record number (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>Layer</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Layer in which the boundary resides. The order of precedence for boundaries which may reside in more than one layer, from highest to lowest, is: CONNECTOR/PARCEL/ROAD, DELETE/PROPOSED, OVERLAP/SURVEY, RAILROAD, UTILITY, DISTRICT, EASEMENT, LOT, PUBLAND, MATCHLINE, BLOCK.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>           <attrdomv>            <edom>              <edomv>(blank)</edomv>               <edomvd>New parcel boundary that has not been placed in the PARCEL layer yet.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>BLOCK</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary forms a block or tax map (section) boundary.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>CONNECTOR</edomv>               <edomvd>Parcel polygon connector line (a.k.a. z-hook).</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>DELETE</edomv>               <edomvd>The parcel boundary has been deleted during the tax year shown in the YEAR field. This line will be shown as a dashed line on the printed maps.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>DISTRICT</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary forms a special district boundary but not a parcel boundary (ie, the parcel has been consolidated across a special district boundary).</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>EASEMENT</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary is part of an easment recorded in the Tompkins County Clerk's Office, and the easment is not recorded or treated as a separate parcel of land.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>HISTLOT</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary is part of a Military Lot or Watkins and Flint Lot boundary. In most cases, these boundaries will be included in the DELETE layer and shown as dashed lines.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>MATCHLINE</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary does not form a parcel boundary, and has never formed a parcel boundary; the line is used to break a larger parcel into smaller polygons that can be shown on the printed maps at the required scales.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>OVERLAP</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary is part of a survey overlap resulting from two or more surveys that were inputted with independent reliable starting points and have similar closure errors. The survey boundaries that are believed to be less accurate are placed in the OVERLAP layer, while the boundaries that are believed more accurate are placed in the PARCEL layer.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>PARCEL</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary forms a parcel boundary. Abandoned road and railroad centerlines will usually be included in this layer.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>PROPOSED</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary forms the centerline of a proposed road, or the boundary of a proposed parcel or subdivision lot (the road, parcel or lot is not currently recorded as active in the tax roll).</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>PUBLAND</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary is part of a public land holding, such as a State Park.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>RAILROAD</edomv>               <edomvd>The centerline of an active or abandoned rail road.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>ROAD</edomv>               <edomvd>The centerline of an active road.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>SURVEY</edomv>               <edomvd>The boundary is part of a survey line that either undershot or overshot a planimetric line that is used as a parcel boundary (these usually occur near water features). These boundaries will preserve the location of pins and pipes, which can be used for other surveys.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>             <edom>              <edomv>UTILITY</edomv>               <edomvd>Utility centerline (power transmission lines, gas tranmission pipes, etc).</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS boundary at this time.</edomvd>               <edomvds>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</edomvds>            </edom>          </attrdomv>        </attr>         <attr> In the case of connectors being shown across more than one map with the difference in map scales <= 50%, then only one connector will be drawn, and the TAXMAP field will be populated with all appropriate tax map (section) numbers, separated by a single space. For example, a connector located between tax maps 10 and 11, with both maps being printed at 1"=400', would receive only one connector, with "10 11" for the TAXMAP field, rather than a separate connector for each map, in two different places.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>TNODE#</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Arc's to-node record number (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>Year</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Tax Year the boundary was actually created or deleted (not necessarily the year the boundary was corrected or inputted into the file).</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>      </detailed>       <detailed>        <enttyp>          <enttypl>Tax Map (Section) Block Boundaries (region.block, CAPRCL2000.PATBLOCK)</enttypl>           <enttypd>"On each section map, groups of parcels of property bounded by streets, highways, waterways, or other prominent features shall be designated as blocks. Each such block shall be given an identifying number which shall be marked on the map within the boundaries of the block. Any block shall not contain more than 99 lots. When a modular section is divided by a city, town, or village boundary line, separate unique block numbers must be assigned within the modular section to each city, town, and village."</enttypd>           <enttypds>\ufffd 189.7 of Preparation and Maintenance of Tax Maps For Real Property Assessment and Taxation Administration, New York State Board Rules, Part 189 (9NYCRR).</enttypds>        </enttyp>         <attr>          <attrlabl>Block</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Tax Map (Section) Block Number</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>BLOCK#</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Block Region Record Number (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>BLOCK-ID</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Block Region User-Id (Internal Software Attribute)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>PERIMETER</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Block Region Perimeter (Internal Software Attribute, in Map Units)</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>Swis</attrlabl>           <attrdef>SWIS Code of municipality in which the block is located.</attrdef>           <attrdefs>Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</attrdefs>           <attrdomv/>        </attr>         <attr>          <attrlabl>SwisBlock</attrlabl>           <attrdef>REDEFINED field beginning at the SWIS field and ending after the BLOCK field.    <enttypl>Tax Parcel Boundaries (region.parcel, CAPRCL2000.PATPARCEL)</enttypl>           <enttypd>(1) "The term land parcel means a term in tax mapping used interchangeably with the term lot. (All real property parcels separately assessed apart from the land shall be identified to the land parcel.) The term lot means a contiguous land area delineated on a tax map under a single fee ownership as far as may be practicable, used or intended for use as a single piece. A lot shall also include each separately delineated lot on a subdivision map accepted for filing by a county clerk, unless the assessor determines the separate assessment of one or more such lots to be impracticable. A lot shall not be divided by a State, county, city, town, village, or school district boundary line; provided, however, that in a special assessing unit where, at the election of the assessor, a land parcel which is separately assessed for general municipal purposes and such parcel lies partly within a village or school district, the portion of the parcel which lies in such village or school district shall be delineated on the tax map and, with respect to such portion, an identifying suffix or suffixes shall be appended to the section, block and lot number assigned to the affected land parcel. In determining what constitutes a lot, an assessor shall regard an abandoned subdivision as a single tract if an instrument abandoning that subdivision has been filed with the assessor and with the clerk of each assessing unit in which the subdivision is located and with the appropriate recording officer." (2) The parcel region should be used for any analysis involving area, perimeter, or total number of parcels, while the printkey region is primarily meant for paper map display.</enttypd>           <enttypds>(1) \ufffd 189.1 (k) and (l) of Preparation and Maintenance of Tax Maps For Real Property Assessment and Taxation Administration, New York State Board Rules, Part 189 (9NYCRR). (2) Tompkins County GIS Program, 1999.</enttypds>        </enttyp>         <attr>          <attrlabl>AccountNum</attrlabl>           <attrdef>Real Property Services (RPS) Database account number, which is used to uniquely identify railroad, state-owned, and utility properties.
